Reviews.Title: Works well with T-Mobile
Reviews.Author: MikeObermeyer
Reviews.Content: This phone is a good value.  The phone's Ice Cream Sandwich OS is responsive and polished.  I have WiFi at home and at work.  I don't care about the time in between. Buying this unlocked phone will save you from getting locked into an expensive data plan for two years.  You will get the full smart phone experience when you have WiFi.  This works fine in Los Angeles with a T-Mobile standard size SIM.  One year later, it has held up well and would buy the phone again.

Reviews.Title: Xperia small version
Reviews.Author: Sameera C
Reviews.Content: Sony Xperia is a very good phone with latest android software. There are several cool apps on the google play. I really like the sound quality of the phone. Overall a good reliable unlocked phone to work with any SIM provider

Reviews.Title: No Flash!
Reviews.Author: Irishgirl358
Reviews.Content: I absolutely LOVED this phone...Until I realized it didn't have an LED light/flash.It's slim, light weight, can fit in your pocket.It's very fast and responsive to touch.The internal memory is a bit larger than the previous Xperia Mini that I owned.Purchasing this, i thought I was getting a bit of an upgrade.In one sense (memory/speed) I was.  In another (no led light) it was a downgrade.Buy it if you don't need the LED flash but if you need it and are looking for something smaller I'd go with the mini.I am in love with the Sony Xperia cell phone line!!!!

Reviews.Title: Great tiny phone
Reviews.Author: Jim H. Liang
Reviews.Content: Recently purchased this phone, but I got the international unlocked version (ST21i) which is identical- just a different SKU. It is a joy to use. It cannot be overstated how refreshing it is to finally use a small handset again. The phone is snappy and quick due to the low amount of pixels it has to push. After swapping the stock launcher for something like NOVA, it is simply brilliant to use.I originally was going to use it as a backup/burner but I am seriously tempted to use it as my daily driver. The only thing holding me back is the very subpar camera. It is fixed focus, and you cannot even tap to focus/adjust the metering. Regardless, the phone itself is great and if you don't plan to take pictures anyway- I cannot recommend it highly enough.

Reviews.Title: Don't buy it from this seller.
Reviews.Author: gypsyair
Reviews.Content: the package came in with a broken package, the seal was good, but the bottom was opened, looked like a returned item, according to their return policy, there would be no way for me to return it to them. plus, they charged restock fee for 20%, so please think twice before you submit your order. I just made a mistake to order the wrong model, the one I want was a dual-sim model. this is my first ever review.update on 12/15/2012,Since no return is possible, I decided to try this little phone. Here is what I found:Pro: 1)speaker is great;  2)battery is good enough at 1500 mAh,  3)call quality is better than Samsung GS II.  4)the pc companion software is easy to use.Con: 1)bad design for the micro sd card slot, you need tools and 10 minutes to take the card out of it.  2)no media player recognizes the mp4 file transferred from pc to the phone, the file can only be played by the xperia gallery.  3)no flash led for the camera, picture quality is below average.  4)just like other small screen phone, typo is common. to avoid call a wrong #, use contact instead.end up buying a sony ion hspa L28h from amazon, well worth the extra $200.

Reviews.Title: Awkward.
Reviews.Author: Eyaare
Reviews.Content: I picked up a Tipo to replace a Samsung Exhibit II 4G Prepaid Android Phone (T-Mobile) I got when I signed up with T-mobile prepaid. The Exhibit is a pretty standard smartphone, so I'll be half comparing the two.Now the first thing I noticed was touch screen issues. It is not something all these phones have, but it is a common issue. Supposedly any Sony Service Center will fix this, or you can get a third party fix online pretty easily. Or you could return the phone. Apparently, though, it's more common that it should be, but not an issue you get stuck with - five minutes and I fixed mine. It's still a pretty cheap touchscreen but it works okay.It's awkward. This phone is chubby. It's short. Weird dimensions. Personally, I like it, but typing takes some time to get used to (as the keyboard is a bit more cramped) and it just feels different to hold in your hand than most smartphones. It's small and fat, which would probably work a lot better on an old Nokia than an Android smartphone. Again, I like it, it feels good to hold, but I can't say it's the most practical thing. Every once in a while I miss a key or two that I wouldn't on my old Samsung.The USB port is on the lower left of the phone, which is just weird. The phone does take a microSD card, but it's a pain to try and remove. It isn't impossible but if you plan on switching cards constantly.... try somewhere else.Additionally, the vibration is cheap. It's difficult to explain, but when you hit a character on the keyboard, the phone gives more of a rattle than the clean thud.Now for some good.The phone has a very premium feel. The Exhibit II follows the typical Samsung attitude of being cheap. It's a light, cheap plastic, something I can only assume is common within Android smartphones of the price range. The Tipo, on the other hand, has a very upscale feel to it. It just feels and looks nice all around, so it's definitely a phone you can feel good about.Tipo's Android has also been Sony'd out. Icons, backgrounds and a custom keyboard (with Swype-esque "gesture control") give the Tipo a very unique and premium feel software-wise as well.It's also probably louder than my laptop. There's a logo for "XLOUD," an audio engine hackers are busy porting to other phones. That's a good sign, right? Either way, it makes it very easy to hear Netflix in a loud restaurant, even if the phone's size might make the image a bit hard to see.As a minor point, it's well packaged. It comes in a very small box, a little rectangle about as big as the phone itself.THE VERDICTUltimately, Tipo probably isn't the best phone for the money. It comes off as a bit of a fashion item that takes a bit of a hit in practicality for the sake of good looks. If you can get used to the size, it is a great looking phone, albeit a bit cheap under-the-skin.

Reviews.Title: Incompatible with most headphones
Reviews.Author: Ruth I. Kuo "alwaysangel"
Reviews.Content: At first glance this seems like a nice little phone. It is on the small side (which some people might like) but that does make typing harder. The screen doesn't have the best viewing angles but for the price you get a snappy little phone running Android 4 ICS. The bad news: Sony has already said they don't plan on updating this phone to Android 4.1 JB so don't expect any updates. There are no headphones supplied with the phone which make the fact that most headphones don't work with this phone even worse. Yep, you read that right - do not expect to be able to use most of your headphones with this phone. I thought I might have had a defective unit but searching on the Sony forums shows that other people are experiencing the same problem.

Reviews.Title: Foreign names and numbers in the contact list.
Reviews.Author: Quil "Phil"
Reviews.Content: Where do we start with this Xperia Tipo?Was advertised as new.  Deep scan located several foreign names and numbers in the contact list that had not been thoroughly erased.  It appeared as new, yet where did those names come from?Camera.  Very few features.  Mediocre long shots, forget zoom as all attempts result in a terrible image.  Naturally, no flash.  Surprisingly, video was not overly bad.There are so many apps forced on the buyer, preinstalled in this phone, and cannot be erased without adding special apps which present problems of their own.  It took a long time to get the constant excessive advertising stopped.The phone has a problem remembering its settings.  What worked yesterday has no clue in the settings tomorrow.Sunlight is a problem with all smartphones, but with this one you are limited to shade strictly at best.Sometimes you have to nearly whomp the touch screen to get it to respond while at other times it is overly sensitive and it is not adjustable.One shining light---conversations and volume are stellar.Overall at 2 and a quarter by 4 it is a compact unit for a smartphone.  It must be considered entry level for this day and age with all the corners Sony has cut on this one and the price reflects that.

Reviews.Title: great
Reviews.Author: Diana Fernandez
Reviews.Content: is the perfect cell phone becuase its easy to handle it, the software is friendly and the brand is one of the best in the market, also the price is great compared to the quality of it

Reviews.Title: good
Reviews.Author: Alejandro
Reviews.Content: I loved it and thanks so much because you made my purchase a really good purchase and a amazing item like this I'm excited

Reviews.Title: great entry level phone
Reviews.Author: Ronald D. Letang
Reviews.Content: phone came brand new and everything worked as expected. it is not top of the line but you pay what you get.

Reviews.Title: I bought this phone
Reviews.Author: D. Chatterjee
Reviews.Content: Its extremely small so maybe not for large hands! I had bought this unlocked phone but the voicemail settings were in Spanish! I still have not figured out how to change it to English! Anyone know how please let me know...otherwise the phone is not bad. The speakers are very loud so the music is good. Camera is horrible don't even bother taking any pictures..no flash!

Reviews.Title: phone for small hands or small fingers
Reviews.Author: frobinson
Reviews.Content: If you have small hands or small fingers, then this might work for you. I don't do a lot of texting, but whenever I do it is very challenging, to say the least. Very small and compact. Camera sucks, but phone is ok. I should have went for the dual sim version.

Reviews.Title: tipo
Reviews.Author: weeehooo
Reviews.Content: like the size and design.  It fits right in my pocket, like the screen, like the music, and most of all like the sound which is more louder than my ion.

Reviews.Title: Ok
Reviews.Author: Whaaat
Reviews.Content: Cute little phone 4 a fair price.  Its not a high end phone but I guess it will do the job.  Smaller than I expected & lacks the better camera U find in $400+ phones

Reviews.Title: about sony xperia
Reviews.Author: Daniela
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice and easy to use phone...It was what I needed and was expecting, very happy with my choice.

Reviews.Title: Good phone
Reviews.Author: gracie
Reviews.Content: It is smaller than I thought, it is my first smart phone, still learning how to use it. Next phone will stay with Sony.

Reviews.Title: Decent as a short-term option
Reviews.Author: Kevin
Reviews.Content: I got this phone when mine crapped out on me, and I didn't have the money to get anything decent. Used it for over a year..Pros: Cheap, android jelly bean, expandable memoryCons: Small screen, too slow for games, hard to text with, no LTE supportI had a problem where it would stop sending my messages, and I'd have to restart the phone to get it to send texts again.This phone is very small, probably less than 5 inches. I probably would get something else if I had another chance, but it'll be a decent replacement for your broken phone for a while.

Reviews.Title: great phone
Reviews.Author: Linda
Reviews.Content: a great little phone that does everything I want it to and is economical, great battery life too, I am glad I bought it

Reviews.Title: excellent phone
Reviews.Author: ACRC "ACRC"
Reviews.Content: Very comfortable. Excellent phone. Maybe it's small for big hands, however it's great. I recommend it. It works very fast. Five stars

Reviews.Title: Excellent
Reviews.Author: Reifon
Reviews.Content: It's a small one but works nicely and very fast, don't have problems running on internet. Great unlocked phone.It's a Sony.........

Reviews.Title: soso
Reviews.Author: meinfla
Reviews.Content: I bought a Tipo for a backup phone. I set it up and ran it on Simple Mobile. The phone was pretty fast I had 3g and 3g+ speeds.I deal breaker is the on/off button, it's small and flush, have to use the tip of your fingernail.Too bad, otherwise nice little unit.

Reviews.Title: great phone for a small price
Reviews.Author: maria
Reviews.Content: I love it.  It is a great phone in very good condition. It also has  screenshot and the battery life lasts a long time. The only problem is that it's smaller than it appears, but otherwise, everything about it is great. It's beyond my expectations regarding it's price.I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Great entry-level smartphone
Reviews.Author: Rodrigo Sanabria Pinto
Reviews.Content: My teenage daughter loves it. Right sized to keep in her pocket, adequate battery life, and all the android apps at hand. She uses it mostly for whatsapp and texting and works fine, she is considering to also use it to replace a dead iPod.

Reviews.Title: realy good
Reviews.Author: NESTOR ADRIAN SAAVEDRA
Reviews.Content: Really good product, but the glass is not really scratch proof like it says, In general lines I recommend it anyway

Reviews.Title: My first smart phone
Reviews.Author: Selwyn Griffith
Reviews.Content: Am enjoying my new SONY XPERIA ST21a2, Like the fact that it is DUAL SIM, has a great volume of internal memory. I can upgrade the apps and  the OS too. Like the features, its attractive, comfortable in the hands. My kids an I are doing lots of activities together with the phone. Worth the price!!!. On the down side, it sticks abit, but I can for give it. Any better deal would be heaven. Thanks SONY(SONIA) my wife and the product company.

Reviews.Title: Very well pleased
Reviews.Author: Alexander
Reviews.Content: I am pretty pleased with this phone. It just takes some time getting used to. The only thing I am not so happy about is the camera quality. You have to be VERY still and concentrated to take a good picture, which can be frustrating. But other features are great. It's got wifi, beautiful wallpapers (live and not), has a music player, good sound quality. Overall, it's a pretty good phone.

Reviews.Title: It's a very excellent phone
Reviews.Author: Francisco
Reviews.Content: A very quickly phone, perfect for every day uses. It has everything that say in the description and has android 4.0.4

Reviews.Title: Very good
Reviews.Author: Luis Blanchard
Reviews.Content: It's a good phone, I brought two months ago to Venezuela and works quite well, do not give it five stars because the had problems with the touch, but it was something I could solve by myself easily, for everything else is perfect so far :)

Reviews.Title: pocket size and international bands
Reviews.Author: antonio f rosario
Reviews.Content: The phone is small enough to fit in pockets.The phone supports several bands for domestic and international use.Any other android phones with these attributes?

Reviews.Title: Works well for an inexpensive android
Reviews.Author: Anthony
Reviews.Content: Phone works well enough. After a few apps installed it seemed to slow down a lot. Tends to freeze for a few seconds after trying to unlock the screen.

Reviews.Title: Its Okay
Reviews.Author: pri
Reviews.Content: Its not what you see on the screen; the phone texture looks like a toy. however the feature listed appears good. I am not sure if its worth the money but i liked it as it looked cute as a toy.

Reviews.Title: Every thing I hoped it would be and more.
Reviews.Author: Kenneth M. Chapman "Ken Chapman"
Reviews.Content: I bought this mobile for my teenage daughter.  She went nuts when she got it.  Lovely, small, fast, great screen, it is truly unlocked, and can work with any SIM card that supports GSM and the frequencies.The dealer was terrific and fast in responding to my questions.  He knew what I was talking about and put my fears to ease.The mobile was delivered as promised, quicker than expected, exactly as promised.  I couldn't be happier.  They made me look like "Daddy the Hero" and that is always a good thing.  Get ready, I will be back for more purchases.

Reviews.Title: touchscreen issues
Reviews.Author: mochi
Reviews.Content: I tried everything calibration fix, updated the firmware, the touchscreen is defective. other than that, it is a pretty cool looking phone

Reviews.Title: its great!!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: its a nice cellphone and i really like the screen, also its very cheap, the only thing I dont like in this phone is dont have Front Camera but I really love this phone!!

Reviews.Title: nice phone for price
Reviews.Author: Justin Wrinkle
Reviews.Content: nice "little" phone for the price, was fast and really did very well on car BT. Callers would comment on how clear the call was compared to my samsungs...

Reviews.Title: An ok phone.
Reviews.Author: Jag
Reviews.Content: This was bought as a replacement for an old sony phone, which we liked very much. This one is quite ok, Smaller screen and the apps are not that good. But for a basic usage, this is more than enough. But for the price, I would go for a Nokia, which has better features, especially for the Map.

Reviews.Title: exelente
Reviews.Author: mario bello
Reviews.Content: exelente equipo el vendedor muy atento y responsable recomiendo el equipo sin dudas bueno y rapido a pesar de ser de gama baja

Reviews.Title: Utter rubbish
Reviews.Author: Marcus Cudmore
Reviews.Content: I bought this phone as an android alternative to my iPhone. Unfortunately it has restored my faith in Apple products. The Sony's screen is fragile and the phone is slow and frustrating. Very disappointed.

Reviews.Title: Its working
Reviews.Author: T. williams "A realy buyer"
Reviews.Content: This phone is very small, most likely for a females hand. Other than that it work well running android os

Reviews.Title: Touch screen unresponsice
Reviews.Author: Sam
Reviews.Content: As a smartphone this product is useless due very unreponsive touchscreen. In typing there is almost 1 second delay.I would return it immediatelly, but unfortunatelly there is return policy in the store I bough this from.

ProductInfo.Features:
The Xperia tipo Android Smartphone lets you enjoy shock horror on-screen not on your phone bill. With the data usage app, you can set the limits you want to use data to surf, chat or game online.
With the powerful battery you can charge your phone and then use it for 24 hours without having to charge it again. Long battery life means you?ll never miss that important call or funny status update again.
It gives you instant access to the web and online content, and a whole host of apps, like email, Google Maps and Google Search . Make your Android Smartphone your own with hundreds of thousands of apps to choose from.
ProductInfo.Name: Sony Xperia Tipo ST21A Unlocked Android Phone--U.S. Warranty (White)
